table_count.description: A number of tables, 0 if unknown.

GetVersionsRequestMySQLd.description: MySQLd is used for mysqld binary version retrieving using `mysqld --version`.

GetVersionsRequestQpress.description: Qpress is used for qpress binary version retrieving.

GetVersionsRequestSoftware.description: Software is used to select software for which retrieve version.

GetVersionsRequestXbcloud.description: Xbcloud is used for xbcloud binary version retrieving.

GetVersionsRequestXtrabackup.description: Xtrabackup is used for xtrabackup binary version retrieving.

GetVersionsResponseVersion.description:
Version contains the version field of the requested software and
the error field which is set in case of version retrieving error.

JobProgressLogs.description: Logs contains generic logs from job.

fingerprint.description: digest_text - query signature. Query without values.

database.description:
Dimension Group.

MongoDB or PostgreSQL database.
Several databases can't be combined in a single declarative query.

schema.description:
MySQL database or PostgreSQL schema.
Several schemas can be combined in a single declarative query.

agent_id.description: Identifier of agent that collect and send metrics.

period_start_unix_secs.description: Time when collection of bucket started.

example.description: One of query example from set found in bucket.

example_format.description: Deprecated: should not be used, should be removed.

is_truncated.description: Indicates if the query example is truncated.

num_queries_with_warnings.description: How many queries was with warnings in bucket.

num_queries_with_errors.description: How many queries was with error in bucket.

m_query_time_cnt.description: How many times query_time was found.

m_query_time_sum.description: The statement execution time in seconds.

m_query_time_min.description: Smallest value of query_time in bucket.

m_query_time_max.description: Biggest value of query_time in bucket.

m_query_time_p99.description: 99 percentile of value of query_time in bucket.

MetricsBucketCommon.description: Common contains common fields for all DBs.

m_response_length_sum.description: The response length of the query result in bytes.

MetricsBucketMongoDB.description: MongoDB contains metrics for Mongo DB.

m_lock_time_sum.description: The time to acquire locks in seconds.

m_rows_sent_sum.description: The number of rows sent to the client.

m_rows_affected_sum.description: Number of rows changed - UPDATE, DELETE, INSERT.

m_rows_read_sum.description: The number of rows read from tables.

m_merge_passes_sum.description: The number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do.

m_innodb_io_r_ops_sum.description: Counts the number of page read operations scheduled.

m_innodb_io_r_bytes_sum.description: Similar to innodb_IO_r_ops, but the unit is bytes.

m_innodb_io_r_wait_sum.description: Shows how long (in seconds) it took InnoDB to actually read the data from storage.

m_innodb_rec_lock_wait_sum.description: Shows how long (in seconds) the query waited for row locks.

m_innodb_queue_wait_sum.description: Shows how long (in seconds) the query spent either waiting to enter the InnoDB queue or inside that queue waiting for execution.

m_innodb_pages_distinct_sum.description: Counts approximately the number of unique pages the query accessed.

m_query_length_sum.description: Shows how long the query is.

m_bytes_sent_sum.description: The number of bytes sent to all clients.

m_tmp_tables_sum.description: Number of temporary tables created on memory for the query.

m_tmp_disk_tables_sum.description: Number of temporary tables created on disk for the query.

m_tmp_table_sizes_sum.description: Total Size in bytes for all temporary tables used in the query.

m_qc_hit_cnt.description:
Boolean metrics:
- *_cnt - how many times this metric was met.
- *_sum - how many times this metric was true.

m_full_scan_sum.description: The query performed a full table scan.

m_full_join_sum.description: The query performed a full join (a join without indexes).

m_tmp_table_sum.description: The query created an implicit internal temporary table.

m_tmp_table_on_disk_sum.description: The querys temporary table was stored on disk.

m_filesort_on_disk_sum.description: The filesort was performed on disk.

m_select_full_range_join_sum.description: The number of joins that used a range search on a reference table.

m_select_range_sum.description: The number of joins that used ranges on the first table.

m_select_range_check_sum.description: The number of joins without keys that check for key usage after each row.

m_sort_range_sum.description: The number of sorts that were done using ranges.

m_sort_scan_sum.description: The number of sorts that were done by scanning the table.

m_no_index_used_sum.description: The number of queries without index.

m_no_good_index_used_sum.description: The number of queries without good index.

m_rows_sum.description: The number of rows sent to the client.

m_shared_blks_hit_sum.description: Total number of shared block cache hits by the statement.

m_shared_blks_read_sum.description: Total number of shared blocks read by the statement.

m_shared_blks_dirtied_sum.description: Total number of shared blocks dirtied by the statement.

m_shared_blks_written_sum.description: Total number of shared blocks written by the statement.

m_local_blks_hit_sum.description: Total number of local block cache hits by the statement.

m_local_blks_read_sum.description: Total number of local blocks read by the statement.

m_local_blks_dirtied_sum.description: Total number of local blocks dirtied by the statement.

m_local_blks_written_sum.description: Total number of local blocks written by the statement.

m_temp_blks_read_sum.description: Total number of temp blocks read by the statement.

m_temp_blks_written_sum.description: Total number of temp blocks written by the statement.

m_blk_read_time_sum.description: Total time the statement spent reading blocks, in milliseconds (if track_io_timing is enabled, otherwise zero).

m_blk_write_time_sum.description: Total time the statement spent writing blocks, in milliseconds (if track_io_timing is enabled, otherwise zero).

m_cpu_user_time_sum.description: Total time user spent in query.

m_cpu_sys_time_sum.description: Total time system spent in query.

m_wal_records_sum.description: Total number of WAL (Write-ahead logging) records.

m_wal_fpi_sum.description: Total number of FPI (full page images) in WAL (Write-ahead logging) records.

m_wal_bytes_sum.description: Total bytes of WAL (Write-ahead logging) records.

m_plan_time_sum.description: Sum, count, min, max of plan time.

top_queryid.title:
Metrics skipped due to different bucket_time in pg_stat_monitor (1min in PMM, 5min in pg_stat_monitor):
min_time, max_time, mean_time
plan_mean_time
stddev_time
Other metrics skipped (empty values, codes):
cmd_type_text, elevel, sqlcode, message, state_code, state

agentExampleFormat.description:
ExampleFormat is format of query example: real or query without values.

Deprecated: is not used, should not be used, should be removed.

agentExampleType.description: ExampleType is a type of query example selected for this query class in given period of time.

agentGetVersionsRequest.description: GetVersionsRequest represents a request for version retrieving of different software.

agentGetVersionsResponse.description: GetVersionsResponse represents a response containing versions of software in the same order as in the request.

agentHistogramItem.description: HistogramItem represents one item in histogram.

agentJobProgress.description: JobProgress represents job progress messages like percentage of completion, status updates, etc.

agentJobProgressMySQLBackup.description: MySQLBackup contains backup job status update.

agentJobProgressMySQLRestoreBackup.description: MySQLRestoreBackup contains restore backup job status update.

agentJobResultMongoDBBackup.description: MongoDBBackup contains result for MongoDB backup job.

agentJobResultMongoDBRestoreBackup.description: MongoDBRestoreBackup contains result for MongoDB restore backup job.

agentJobResultMySQLBackup.description: MySQLBackup contains result for MySQL backup job.

agentJobResultMySQLRestoreBackup.description: MySQLRestoreBackup contains result for MySQL restore backup job.

agentJobStatusRequest.description: JobStatusRequest is a ServerMessage asking pmm-agent for job status.

agentJobStatusResponse.description: JobStatusResponse is an AgentMessage containing job status.

agentMetricsBucket.description:
MetricsBucket is aggregated message created by pmm-agent.
Contains information about one query selected in defined way from query class in specific period of time.

agentMysqlExplainOutputFormat.description:
MysqlExplainOutputFormat output formats supported by MySQL Explain action.

 - MYSQL_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT_FORMAT_DEFAULT: EXPLAIN FORMAT=TRADITIONAL, returns result as text
 - MYSQL_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT_FORMAT_JSON: EXPLAIN FORMAT=JSON
 - MYSQL_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT_FORMAT_TRADITIONAL_JSON: EXPLAIN FORMAT=TRADITIONAL, returns result as JSON

DSN for the MongoDB service. May contain connection (dial) timeout.
May contain placeholders for file paths in DSN.

enabled.description: Specifies if PITR should be enabled or disabled.

agentPBMSwitchPITRRequest.description: PBMSwitchPITRRequest is a ServerMessage asking pmm-agent to switch PITR pbm feature.

agentPBMSwitchPITRResponse.description: PBMSwitchPITRResponse is an AgentMessage for PBMSwitchPITRRequest success result.

agentPing.description: Ping is a AgentMessage/ServerMessage for checking connectivity, latency and clock drift.

agentPong.description: Pong is an AgentMessage/ServerMessage with current time for measuring clock drift.

agentQANCollectRequest.description: QANCollectRequest is an AgentMessage for sending QAN data for qan-api.

agentQANCollectResponse.description: QANCollectResponse is a ServerMessage for QAN data acceptance.

status.description:
The responder sets the status field in two situations:
1. When it received a request with the payload field not set.
   That means that responded is older than the requester, and doesn't know about newer payload types.
   Status code UNIMPLEMENTED (12) is reserved for that case.
2. When the payload is set, but the request can't be performed due to some error.

agentSetStateRequest.description: SetStateRequest is a ServerMessage asking pmm-agent to run agents according to desired state.

agentSetStateResponse.description: SetStateResponse is an AgentMessage for SetStateRequest acceptance.

timeout.description: Timeout for the whole action. If zero or absent, pmm-agent will pick one itself.

agentStartActionRequest.description: StartActionRequest is a ServerMessage asking pmm-agent to start action.

agentStartActionResponse.description: StartActionResponse is an AgentMessage for StartActionRequest acceptance.

agentStartJobRequest.description: StartJobRequest is a ServerMessage asking pmm-agent to start job.

address.description: Database address. Can't be specified with socket.

port.description: Database port. Can't be specified with socket.

socket.description: Database unix socket. Can't be specified with address/port.

files.description: files contains files which can be used to connect to DB (certificates, keys and etc).

template_left_delim.description: template_left_delim is used to replace placeholders in templates (DSN and etc.) with paths to files.

template_right_delim.description: template_right_delim is used to replace placeholders in templates (DSN and etc.) with paths to files.

agentTextFiles.description: TextFiles contains files which can be used to connect to DB (certificates, keys and etc).

inventoryAgentStatus.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.
 - UNKNOWN: Agent is not connected, we don't know anything about it's state.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).
